original: 9. Uttarikaraṇīyapañha
analyzed: uttari karaṇīya pañha
translated: The Questions of Uttara

original: “Bhante nāgasena, tumhe bhaṇatha—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena tumhe bhaṇatha
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, you say:

original: ‘yaṁ kiñci karaṇīyaṁ tathāgatassa, sabbaṁ taṁ bodhiyāyeva mūle pariniṭṭhitaṁ, natthi tathāgatassa uttariṁ karaṇīyaṁ, katassa vā paticayo’ti, idañca temāsaṁ paṭisallānaṁ dissati.
analyzed: yat kiñci karaṇīyam tathāgatassa sabbam tat bodhiyāya iva mūle na atthi tathāgatassa uttarim karaṇīya katassa vā paticayo ti idam ca temāsam paṭisallānam dissati
translated: ‘Whatever the Tathāgata had to do, he did it all at the foot of the Bodhi Tree; there is nothing more for the Tathāgata to do, nor is there anything that needs to be done.’ But it is seen that he spent three months in seclusion.

original: Yadi, bhante nāgasena, yaṁ kiñci karaṇīyaṁ tathāgatassa, sabbaṁ taṁ bodhiyāyeva mūle🔽pariniṭṭhitaṁ, natthi tathāgatassa uttariṁ karaṇīyaṁ, katassa vā paticayo, tena hi
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena yam kiñci karaṇīyam tathāgatassa sabbam tam bodhiyāya iva mūle  pariniṭṭhita na atthi tathāgatassa uttarim karaṇīya katassa vā paticayaḥ tena hi
translated: If, revered Nāgasena, whatever the Tathāgata had to do, he did it all at the foot of the Bodhi Tree,

original: ‘temāsaṁ paṭisallīno’ti yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: yam tam micchā
translated: then it is not true that ‘there is nothing more for the Tathāgata to do, nor is there anything that needs to be done.’

original: Yadi temāsaṁ paṭisallīno, tena hi ‘yaṁ kiñci karaṇīyaṁ, tathāgatassa, sabbaṁ taṁ bodhiyāyeva mūle pariniṭṭhitan’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: yadi temāsam paṭisallīnaḥ tena hi yam kiñci tathāgatassa sabbam tam bodhiyāya iva mūle pariniṭṭhitan ti tat pi vacanam micchā
translated: If he spent three months in seclusion, then it is not true that ‘whatever the Tathāgata had to do, he did it all at the foot of the Bodhi Tree.’

original: Natthi katakaraṇīyassa paṭisallānaṁ, sakaraṇīyasseva paṭisallānaṁ yathā nāma byādhitasseva bhesajjena karaṇīyaṁ hoti, abyādhitassa kiṁ bhesajjena.
analyzed: natthi kata karaṇīyassa paṭisallāna sa karaṇīyassa iva paṭisallānam yathā nāma byādhitassa iva bhesajjena karaṇīyam hoti a byādhitassa kim bhesajjena
translated: There is no seclusion for one who has done what he had to do, but only for one who has something still to do. Just as medicine is needed only for one who is ill, not for one who is well,

original: Chātasseva bhojanena karaṇīyaṁ hoti, achātassa kiṁ bhojanena.
analyzed: chātassa iva bhojanena karaṇīyam hoti a chātassa kim bhojanena
translated: so too food is needed only for one who is hungry, not for one who is not hungry.

original: Evameva kho, bhante nāgasena, natthi katakaraṇīyassa paṭisallānaṁ, sakaraṇīyasseva paṭisallānaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho bhante nāgasena na atthi kata karaṇīyassa paṭisallāna sa karaṇīyassa iva paṭisallāna
translated: In the same way, revered Nāgasena, there is no seclusion for one who has done what he had to do, but only for one who has something still to do.

original: Ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho tavānuppatto, so tayā nibbāhitabbo”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi ubhatas koṭikaḥ pañho tava anuppatto saḥ tayā nibbāhitabbaḥ ti
translated: This double-pronged question has been put to you; it is for you to solve it.”

original: “Yaṁ kiñci, mahārāja, karaṇīyaṁ tathāgatassa, sabbaṁ taṁ bodhiyāyeva mūle pariniṭṭhitaṁ,
analyzed: yam kiñci mahā rāja karaṇīyam tathāgatassa sabbam tam bodhiyāya iva mūle pariniṭṭhita
translated: “Whatever the Tathāgata had to do, sire, all that he did at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: natthi tathāgatassa uttariṁ karaṇīyaṁ, katassa vā paticayo, bhagavā ca temāsaṁ paṭisallīno,
analyzed: natthi tathāgatassa uttarim karaṇīya katassa vā paticayaḥ bhagavā ca temāsam paṭisallīnaḥ
translated: There is nothing more for the Tathāgata to do or to add to what he has done. The Blessed One has been in seclusion for three months.

original: paṭisallānaṁ kho, mahārāja, bahuguṇaṁ, sabbepi tathāgatā paṭisallīyitvā sabbaññutaṁ
analyzed: paṭisallānam kho mahā rāja bahuguṇa sabbe api tathāgatāḥ paṭisallīyitvā sabbaññu ta
translated: Seclusion, sire, is of great advantage. All the Tathāgatas, after they had attained to omniscience,

original: pattā, taṁ te sukataguṇamanussarantā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti.
analyzed: pattā tam te su kata guṇam anussarantā paṭisallānam sevanti
translated: remembered the virtue of seclusion and practised it.

original: Yathā, mahārāja, puriso rañño santikā laddhavaro paṭiladdhabhogo taṁ sukataguṇamanussaranto aparāparaṁ rañño upaṭṭhānaṁ eti;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja purisaḥ rañño santikā laddha varaḥ paṭiladdha bhogo tam su kata guṇam anussarantaḥ apara aparam rañño upaṭṭhānam eti
translated: As, sire, a man who has received a boon and obtained wealth from a king, remembering the king’s good qualities, goes again and again to attend on him;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, sabbepi tathāgatā paṭisallīyitvā sabbaññutaṁ pattā, taṁ te sukataguṇamanussarantā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja sabbe api tathāgatā paṭisallīyitvā sabbaññu tam pattā tam te su kata guṇam anussarantā paṭisallānam sevanti
translated: even so, sire, all the Tathāgatas, having retired and attained omniscience, remember those good qualities and resort to retirement.

original: Yathā vā pana, mahārāja, puriso āturo dukkhito bāḷhagilāno bhisakkamupasevitvā sotthimanuppatto taṁ sukataguṇamanussaranto aparāparaṁ bhisakkamupasevati;
analyzed: yathā vā pana mahā rāja purisaḥ āturaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ bhisakkam upasevitvā sotthim anuppattaḥ tam su kata guṇam anussarantaḥ apara aparam bhisakkam upasevati
translated: Or, as, sire, a man who is sick, suffering, and very ill, having attended on a physician and recovered his health, remembers the physician’s good qualities and attends on him again and again;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, sabbepi tathāgatā paṭisallīyitvā sabbaññutaṁ pattā, taṁ te sukataguṇamanussarantā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja sabbe api tathāgatā paṭisallīyitvā sabbaññu tam pattā tam te su kata guṇam anussarantā paṭisallānam sevanti
translated: even so, sire, all the Tathāgatas, having retired and attained omniscience, remember those good qualities and resort to retirement.

original: Aṭṭhavīsati kho panime, mahārāja, paṭisallānaguṇā, ye guṇe samanussarantā tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti.
analyzed: aṭṭhavīsati kho panime mahā rāja paṭisallāna guṇāḥ ye guṇe samanussarantā tathāgatā paṭisallānam sevanti
translated: There are, sire, twenty-eight qualities of retirement, remembering which the Tathāgatas resort to retirement.

original: Katame aṭṭhavīsati?
analyzed: katame aṭṭhavīsati
translated: What are the twenty-eight?

original: Idha, mahārāja, paṭisallānaṁ paṭisallīyamānaṁ attānaṁ rakkhati, āyuṁ vaḍḍheti, balaṁ
analyzed: idha mahā rāja paṭisallānam paṭisallīyamānam attānam rakkhati āyum vaḍḍheti bala
translated: Here, sire, seclusion protects the self, increases life,

original: deti, vajjaṁ pidahati, ayasamapaneti, yasamupaneti, aratiṁ vinodeti, ratimupadahati,
analyzed: deti vajjam pidahati ayasam apaneti yasam upaneti aratim vinā udeti ratim upadahati
translated: gives strength, wards off blame, removes disgrace, brings fame, dispels discontent, gives delight,

original: bhayamapaneti, vesārajjaṁ karoti, kosajjamapaneti, vīriyamabhijaneti, rāgamapaneti,
analyzed: bhayam apaneti vesārajjam karoti kosajjam apaneti vīriyam abhijaneti rāgam apaneti
translated: removes fear, gives confidence, removes sloth, increases energy, removes greed,

original: dosamapaneti, mohamapaneti, mānaṁ nihanti, vitakkaṁ bhañjati, cittaṁ ekaggaṁ karoti,🔽mānasaṁ snehayati, hāsaṁ janeti, garukaṁ karoti, lābhamuppādayati, namassiyaṁ karoti,
analyzed: dosam apaneti moham apaneti mānam nihanti vitakkam bhañjati cittam ekaggam karoti  mānasam snehayati hāsam janeti garukam karoti lābham uppādayati namassiyam karoti
translated: removes hate, removes delusion, destroys conceit, breaks up thought, unifies the mind,🔽oils the mind, produces laughter, makes one respected, brings gain, makes one worthy of offerings,

original: pītiṁ pāpeti, pāmojjaṁ karoti, saṅkhārānaṁ sabhāvaṁ dassayati, bhavappaṭisandhiṁ
analyzed: pītim pāpeti pāmojjam karoti saṅkhārānam sabhāvam dassayati bhava paṭisandhi
translated: brings joy, produces gladness, shows the nature of formations, removes the rebirth-linking of becoming,

original: ugghāṭeti, sabbasāmaññaṁ deti.
analyzed: ugghāṭeti sabba sāmaññam deti
translated: gives all that is needed for a recluse.

original: Ime kho, mahārāja, aṭṭhavīsati paṭisallānaguṇā, ye guṇe samanussarantā tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti.
analyzed: ime kho mahā rāja aṭṭhavīsati paṭisallāna guṇāḥ ye guṇe samanussarantā tathāgatā paṭisallānam sevanti
translated: These, sire, are the twenty-eight qualities of seclusion, recollecting which the Tathāgatas enjoy seclusion.

original: Api ca kho, mahārāja, tathāgatā santaṁ sukhaṁ samāpattiratiṁ anubhavitukāmā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti pariyositasaṅkappā.
analyzed: api ca kho mahā rāja tathāgatā santam sukham samāpatti ratim anubhavitu kāmā paṭisallānam sevanti pariyosita saṅkappā
translated: But, sire, the Buddhas resort to solitude because they wish to experience the bliss of concentration. They have finished their purpose.

original: Catūhi kho, mahārāja, kāraṇehi tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti.
analyzed: catūhi kho mahā rāja kāraṇehi tathāgatāḥ paṭisallānam sevanti
translated: Sire, the Buddhas resort to solitude for four reasons.

original: Katamehi catūhi?🔽Vihāraphāsutāyapi, mahārāja, tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti, anavajjaguṇabahulatāyapi
analyzed: katamehi catūhi  vihāra phāsu tāya api mahā rāja tathāgatā paṭisallānam sevanti anavajja guṇa bahula tāya api
translated: What are the four?🔽The Buddhas resort to solitude, sire, because of the danger of living in a house,🔽because of the abundance of blameless qualities,

original: tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti, asesaariyavīthitopi tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti,
analyzed: tathāgatā paṭisallānam sevanti asesaariya vīthitaḥ pi tathāgatā paṭisallānam sevanti
translated: because of the complete noble way of life,

original: sabbabuddhānaṁ thutathomitavaṇṇitapasatthatopi tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti.
analyzed: sabba buddhānam thuta thomita vaṇṇita pasatthataḥ pi tathāgatāḥ paṭisallānam sevanti
translated: and because of the praise, fame and renown of all the Buddhas.

original: Imehi kho, mahārāja, catūhi kāraṇehi tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti.
analyzed: imehi kho mahā rāja catūhi kāraṇehi tathāgatāḥ paṭisallānam sevanti
translated: These, sire, are the four reasons why the Buddhas resort to solitude.

original: Iti kho, mahārāja, tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevanti na sakaraṇīyatāya, na katassa vā paticayāya, atha kho guṇavisesadassāvitāya tathāgatā paṭisallānaṁ sevantī”ti.
analyzed: iti kho mahā rāja tathāgatā paṭisallānam sevanti na sa karaṇīya tāya na katassa vā paticayāya atha kho guṇa visesa dassāvitāya tathāgatā paṭisallānam sevanti iti
translated: Thus, sire, the Buddhas resort to solitude not because they have something to do or because they have finished what they had to do, but because they wish to see the special qualities of solitude the Buddhas resort to solitude.”🔽“Revered Nāgasena, what is the reason why the Buddhas resort to solitude?”

original: “Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, evametaṁ tathā sampaṭicchāmī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena evam etam tathā sampaṭicchāmi iti
translated: “Excellent, revered Nāgasena. So it is, therefore do I accept this statement.”

original: Uttarikaraṇīyapañho navamo.
analyzed: uttarikaraṇīya pañhaḥ navamo
translated: The ninth discussion is concluded.
